intro: Carramboa badilloi var. pittieri, commonly known as the Pittier's carramboa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, while its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
